text: Corin William Redgrave (16 July 1939 â€“ 6 April 2010) was an English actor and activist, who is known for his roles in All Man for All Seasons, Four Weddings and a Funeral, Oh! What a Lovely War, The Forsyte Saga, and in Persuasion. Redgrave was born on 16 July 1939 in Marylebone, London, England. He studied at the Westminster School and at King's College, Cambridge. Redgrave was married to Deirdre Hamilton-Hill from 1962 until they divorced in 1975. Then he was married to Kika Markham from 1985 until his death in 2010. They had four children. Redgrave died on 6 April 2010 in Tooting, London, England from prostate cancer, aged 70.
